question.text: The correct combination of characters regarding slime molds is

options.text: parasitic, plasmodium with true walls, spores dispersed by air currents
parasitic, plasmodium without walls, spores dispersed by water
saprophytic, plasmodium without walls, spores dispersed by water
saprophytic, plasmodium without walls, spores dispersed by air currents

solution.text: Slime molds are saprophytic protists, this feature is similar to fungus so they are also called fungus-like Protists. Under favorable conditions, they form an aggregation called plasmodium which may grow and spread over several feet. During adverse conditions, this plasmodium differentiates and forms fruiting bodies bearing spores at their tips. They are highly resistant and survive for many years, even under adverse conditions. Their spores are dispersed by air currents.
